text:

protein sequence accumulation mutations, thereby reshaping cell

heading: 2.1 Experiment design
text:
experiment, selected eight strains population
1,011 S. cerevisiae isolates, representing overall ecological, geographical
genetic diversity (Figure 2.1.eight strains grown synthetic defined media (SD). carefully monitored
strains growth harvest cells close mid-log phase (OD ~ 0.5). ,
proceed wash samples PBS flash-freeze cell pellets 
whole-lysate proteomics profiling.strains, prepared biological replicates originated two
distinct colonies two technical replicates.
Figure 2.1: Phylogenetic tree 1011 cerevisiae isolates highlighting 8 strains used RNASeq/RiboSeq/proteomics exepriment
Altogether 32 samples yeast cell pellets including 4 replicates
(two biological two technical) sent Weizmann proteomics unit.
(INPCM).samples submitted correspond 4mL cultures OD ranging 0.4-0.8.OD samples (table)

heading: 2.2 Sample preparation
text:
cell pellets subjected lysis solution tryptic digestion using
S-Trap method (Protifi) followed solid phase extraction cleaning step (Oasis HLB).

heading: 2.3 Liquid chromatography mass spectrometry
text:
resulting peptides analyzed using nanoflow liquid chromatography
(nanoAcquity) coupled high resolution, high mass accuracy mass spectrometry
(Thermo Exploris 480). sample analyzed instrument separately 
random order discovery mode.

heading: 2.4 Peptide identification and quantification
text:
Raw data processed MaxQuant v1.6.6.0. data searched 
Andromeda search engine database containing protein sequences 
Saccharomyces cerevisiae downloaded Uniprot.org, appended 
common lab protein contaminants.following modifications defined search:
Fixed modification- cysteine carbamidomethylation.
Variable modifications- methionine oxidation protein N-terminal acetylation.quantitative comparisons calculated using Perseus v1.6.0.7.
Decoy hits filtered proteins detected
least two replicates least one experimental group kept.

heading: 4 Parts
text: can add parts organize one book chapters together. Parts can inserted top .Rmd file, first-level chapter heading file.Add numbered part: # (PART) Act one {-} (followed # chapter)Add unnumbered part: # (PART\*) Act one {-} (followed # chapter)Add appendix special kind un-numbered part: # (APPENDIX) stuff {-} (followed # chapter). Chapters appendix prepended letters instead numbers.

heading: 5.1 Footnotes
text: Footnotes put inside square brackets caret ^[]. Like one.1

heading: 5.2 Citations
text:
Reference items bibliography file(s) using @key.example, using bookdown package2 (check last code chunk index.Rmd see citation key added) sample book, built top R Markdown knitr3 (citation added manually external file book.bib).
Note .bib files need listed index.Rmd YAML bibliography key.bs4_book theme makes footnotes appear inline click . example book, added csl: chicago-fullnote-bibliography.csl index.Rmd YAML, include .csl file. download new style, recommend: https://www.zotero.org/styles/RStudio Visual Markdown Editor can also make easier insert citations: https://rstudio.github.io/visual-markdown-editing/#/citations
